In this study, a methodology for biorefinery synthesis was developed, considering technical, economic, and exergetic factors, to determine the convenience of additional investments. The methodology was applied to a biorefinery based on African palm as a case study, biomass found in 124 municipalities in Colombia,
8 and was gaining great importance in different industries. Companies are choosing to use the waste obtained from their main production process (palm oil); to manufacture by-products with a high added value, palm kernel oil and palm cake have been presented in recent times as suitable alternatives.
